[[Category:Monsters]][[Category:Templates]] {| style="background:#f5faff; border:1px solid #cedff2; width:auto; margin: 0px 5%; margin-bottom:1.25em; font-style:italic; text-align:left; color:#000; padding:1.5em 1em;" |- | | style="width: 100%;" | A fast-moving arachnid that both surprises its prey and evades its enemies by concealing itself in crannies in the dungeon floor. |} [[Category:Templates]] ==Useful Info== '''Trapdoor spiders''' are territorial monsters that are normally content to [[Submerges|hide]] underground. However, if you step adjacent to their tile, they will leap out and attack. They are somewhat fragile, but fast and [[poison]]ous, and the fact that you can only find them by walking into melee range makes escape very challenging. They can occasionally be found in [[the Dungeon]] and in [[Labyrinth]]s, but are much more commonly found throughout the [[Spider's Nest]]. ==Tips & Tricks== *[[Ensorcelled Hibernation]] does not work as well as you might hope against these; once put to sleep, they immediately burrow back underground. [[Mephitic Cloud]]-confused spiders, on the other hand, are incapable of escaping in that manner. *[[Ignite Poison]] can hurt them even when they're underground. ==History== Trapdoor spiders were removed in [[0.18]].
